Container.Name: sabnzbd-extended
Container.Overview: SABnzbd makes Usenet as simple and streamlined as possible by automating everything we can. All you have to do is add an .nzb. SABnzbd takes over from there, where it will be automatically downloaded, verified, repaired, extracted and filed away with zero human interaction.[br] [br][br][b][span style='color: #E80000;']Important Paths:[/span][/u][/b] [b]/config[/b] :: Location of SABnzbd aplication files [b]/config/scripts[/b] :: Location of SABnzbd post process script files (Add this to SABnzbd to enable script usage) [b]/config/scripts/logs[/b] :: Location of log files [b]/config/scripts/configs[/b] :: Location of SMA config files [br][br][b][span style='color: #E80000;']Important SABNzbd Categories:[/span][/u][/b] [b]lidarr[/b] :: Create Category and map script [b]audio-pp.bash[/b] [b]radarr[/b] :: Create Category and map script [b]video-pp.bash[/b] [b]sonarr[/b] :: Create Category and map script [b]video-pp.bash[/b] [br][br][b][span style='color: #E80000;']Scripts/Files included:[/span][/u][/b] [b]audio-pp.bash[/b] :: Automatically clean up downloaded audio files and convert to standardized format if desired [b]video-pp.bash[/b] :: Verify incoming video files for required audio/subtitle languages and process with SMA if enabled [br][br][b][span style='color: #E80000;']Sickbeard MP4 Automater (SMA):[/span][/u][/b] [b]Config Files Location:[/b] /config/scripts/configs [b]radarr-sma.ini[/b] :: config file for SMA radarr category [b]sonarr-sma.ini[/b] :: config file for SMA sonarr category [b]Log Files Location:[/b] /config/scripts/logs [b]sma.log[/b] :: Log file for SMA For more detailed configuration info, visit: https://github.com/mdhiggins/sickbeard_mp4_automator [br][br][b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Intel GPU Use[/span][/u][/b][br]Edit your [b]go[/b] file to include:[br][b]modprobe i915[br][/b], save and reboot, then [br]add [b]--device=/dev/dri[/b] to [b]"extra parameters"[/b] (switch on advanced view)

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Target Format
Config.Description: FLAC or OPUS or MP3 or AAC or ALAC - converts lossless FLAC files to set format

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Target Format Bitrate
Config.Description: Set to desired bitrate when converting to OPUS/MP3/FDK-AAC/AAC format types

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Verify Downloaded Tracks
Config.Description: TRUE = ENABLED, Verifies FLAC/MP3 files for errors (fixes MP3's, deletes bad FLAC files)

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Detect Single File Albums
Config.Description: TRUE = ENABLED :: Detects single file albums and mark download as failed if detected

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Replaygain FLAC tagging
Config.Description: TRUE = ENABLED, adds replaygain tags for compatible players (FLAC ONLY)

Config.Name: Video Post Processor: Required Audio/Subtitle Language
Config.Description: Default: eng :: Set to required language (ISO 639-2 language code), if not found, will mark as failed

Config.Name: Video Post Processor: Process with MKV Cleaner
Config.Description: TRUE = Enabled :: Uses MKVToolNix to remove unwanted audio/subtitle streams and sets UND audio language based on Required Audio/Subtitle Language setting

Config.Name: Video Post Processor: Encode with Sickbeard MP4 Automator (SMA)
Config.Description: TRUE = Enabled :: Uses SMA to process incoming video files

Config.Name: Video Post Processor: Tag with Sickbeard MP4 Automator (SMA)
Config.Description: TRUE = Enabled :: Uses SMA to Tag MP4 files (Enabled SMA process: manual.py -a; Disabled SMA Process: manual.py -nt)

Container.Description: SABnzbd makes Usenet as simple and streamlined as possible by automating everything we can. All you have to do is add an .nzb. SABnzbd takes over from there, where it will be automatically downloaded, verified, repaired, extracted and filed away with zero human interaction.
